info.title: webPilot
info.description:
Start with a Request: Users can either directly request the 'longContentWriter' to write a long form article or choose to use 'webPageReader' for information gathering before content creation. In both scenarios, before using the 'longContentWriter' service, I confirm all details of their request with the user, including the writing task (task), content summary (summary), writing style (style), and any additional information they provide.
Information Gathering with 'webPageReader': When 'webPageReader' is used, I search the internet and gather relevant information based on the writing task. If more information is needed to enhance the article's depth and accuracy, I continue using 'webPageReader', integrating this information into the reference section.
Content Generation by 'longContentWriter': After confirming all details with the user, including any additional contributions and enhanced information from 'webPageReader', I proceed to generate the long-form content. This ensures the content aligns with the specified requirements and style.
Delivery of the Final Article: Upon completion, the content is delivered to the user for review. They can request revisions or additional information if necessary.
Default Assumptions in Responses: When users request content creation, especially in areas requiring specific knowledge like Bitcoin trends, I will make an initial assumption about the writing style and target audience. For instance, I might assume a technical analysis style aimed at professionals. I will then ask the user if this assumption is okay or if they need any modifications. This approach helps streamline the content creation process.

task.description: The "task" field outlines the specific requirements and objectives for generating the content. This includes detailed instructions on what needs to be accomplished through the writing, such as the main topic to be covered, any particular arguments or perspectives to be presented, and the desired outcome or impact of the piece. This field serves as a directive for the content creation process, ensuring that the writing not only adheres to the given guidelines but also effectively achieves its intended purpose, whether it's to inform, persuade, entertain, or educate the audience.

language.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.

summary.description: The "summary" field encapsulates a concise overview of the writing content, presenting the core themes, key points, and primary objectives of the piece. This brief but comprehensive synopsis serves as a roadmap, guiding the overall direction and focus of the writing, ensuring that it remains aligned with the intended message and purpose throughout the development process. This summary not only aids in maintaining coherence and relevance but also provides a clear preview of what the reader can expect from the full content.

reference.description: The "reference" field is a curated collection of information sourced from the Internet via WebPilot, or proveded by the user, specifically tailored to enrich and support the writing task at hand. It involves a selective process where relevant data, facts, and insights related to the topic are gathered, ensuring that the content is not only well-informed and accurate but also closely aligned with the specific requirements and objectives of the writing project. This field acts as a foundation, providing a rich base of verified and pertinent information from which the article or content is crafted. This field would be long.

style.description: The "style" field in content creation is a detailed framework encompassing three pivotal components - the writing tone or style, the target audience, and the publication medium. This field is structured as "[specific writing style], aimed at [target audience], using [language style], inspired by [notable content creator]." The writing style element ranges from formal and analytical to casual and engaging, setting the overall tone. The target audience aspect identifies the specific reader group, such as students, professionals, or the general public, tailoring the content's complexity and relevance. The language style, whether academic, colloquial, or technical, shapes the linguistic approach. The final component, inspired by a notable content creator, serves as a reference for the desired tone and approach, like "analytical and concise, aimed at business professionals, using professional language, inspired by a renowned business journalist." This clear and structured definition ensures the content is effectively aligned with the audience's needs and the publication's format.

title.description: The title of this web page

content.description: The content of the web page's url to be summarized

meta.description: The Html meta info of the web page

links.description: Some links in the web page

title.description: the title of this search result

link.description: the link of this search result

snippet.description: the snippet of this search result

todo.description: what to do with the content

tips.description: Tips placed at the end of the answer

rules.description: Adherence is required when outputting content.

link.description: Required, The web page's url to visit and retrieve content from.

ur.description: Required, a clear statement of the user's request, can be used as a search query and may include search operators.

lp.description: Required, Whether the link is directly provided by the user

rt.description: If the last request doesn't meet user's need, set this to true when trying to retry another request.

l.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.

info.title: Expedia Travel Recommendation Service
info.description: A service that allows to search travel products by search query and returns recommended products.

get.summary: API provides the top 3 recommended lodging travel products in the given destination.

parameters.name: user_input_in_english
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) The merged user inputs according to the conversation context, translate to ENGLISH, DO NOT ONLY return the last query.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Keywords associated with TRAVEL in the user_input_in_english parameter, converted to all LOWERCASE, separated by | character.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) The destination can be a city, address, airport or a landmark.

parameters.name: check_in
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: check_out
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: property_types
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) An array that accepts one or more of the property enums defined below ONLY. Hotels are interpreted as HOTEL, vacation rentals as VR, resorts as RESORT.

parameters.name: number_of_travelers
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Applicable to vacation rentals only. An integer used to specify the total number of travelers for accommodations.

parameters.name: min_bedrooms
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Applicable to vacation rentals only. An integer used to specify minimum number of bedrooms.

parameters.name: amenities
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) An array that accepts one or more of the following amenity enums based on property_types.

parameters.name: guest_rating
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) A string value limited to only one of the guest-rating enums. If the rating is an integer >=4.5, interpret it as WONDERFUL, if it is >=4, as VERY_GOOD, if it is >=3, as GOOD.

parameters.name: star_ratings
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Array limited to one or more of the star-rating enums. If request is for a luxury hotel, use [4,5]; for moderate use [3,3]; for a specific rating x use [x,x] instead of just x

parameters.name: sort_type
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) A string value that allows user to get accommodations with the specified sort order.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Distance around the given destination (in miles) to look up for options. Default unit is in miles.

parameters.name: user_input_in_english
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) The merged user inputs according to the conversation context, translate to ENGLISH, DO NOT ONLY return the last query.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Keywords associated with TRAVEL in the user_input_in_english parameter, converted to all LOWERCASE, separated by | character.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Origin location name or airport code.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Destination location name or airport code.

parameters.name: departure_date
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: airline_code
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) 2 letter Airline code.

parameters.name: number_of_stops
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Number of stops preferred. 0 means non-stop, 1 means either 0 or 1 stop etc.

parameters.name: sort_type
parameters.description: Optional string value that allows user to get Flights with the specified sort order. \ \ Use PRICE to sort by cheapest, DURATION to sort by shortest duration flight. Default is PRICE.

parameters.name: refundable
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Optional boolean value that allows users to retrieve only refundable flights when set to true. Default is false.

parameters.name: filter_near_by_airport
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Optional boolean value to filter nearby airports, ensuring only results matching the request's airport code are returned when set to true. Default is false.

parameters.name: filter_basic_economy
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Optional boolean value that filters out all Basic Economy fare solutions in the flight search response when set to `true`. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: cabin_class
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Optional string value that allows users to filter results based on their desired cabin class. Default is economy.

get.summary: Get a list of activity travel products

parameters.name: user_input_in_english
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) The merged user inputs according to the conversation context, translate to ENGLISH, DO NOT ONLY return the last query.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Keywords associated with TRAVEL in the user_input_in_english parameter, converted to all LOWERCASE, separated by | character.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) City name, street address, three-letter IATA Airport Code or a landmark name.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) An array that accepts one or more of the following category enums. For example if the activity category is "family-friendly", interpret it as FAMILY_FRIENDLY.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Enum value that allows getting activities within the specified duration. Match the user stated duration preference to the appropriate enum value.

parameters.name: price_max
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) The maximum price of an activity.

get.summary: Get a list of car travel products

parameters.name: user_input_in_english
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) The merged user inputs according to the conversation context, translate to ENGLISH, DO NOT ONLY return the last query.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Keywords associated with TRAVEL in the user_input_in_english parameter, converted to all LOWERCASE, separated by | character.

parameters.name: pickup_location
parameters.description: (MANDATORY parameter) Car rental pick-up location. It can be a city name, address, airport code or a landmark name.

parameters.name: dropoff_location
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Car rental drop-off location. It can be a city name, address, airport code or a landmark name. By default, it is same as that of pick-up location.

parameters.name: pickup_date
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: pickup_time
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any time format and convert to HH:MM (24-hour format).

parameters.name: dropoff_date
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any date format and convert to YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: dropoff_time
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) Accept any time format and convert to HH:MM (24-hour format).

parameters.name: car_classes
parameters.description: (OPTIONAL parameter) This value is used to filter API queries to only return a certain type(s) of car(s).

EXTRA_INFORMATION_TO_ASSISTANT.description: Specific instructions on how assistant is supposed to handle the data included in the API response

location_description.description: Short location description of the hotel.

max_occupancy.description: Maximum occupancy allowed for the accommodation.

number_of_bedrooms.description: Number of bedrooms in the property.

guest_rating.description: The guest rating of the hotel in expedia web site, max rating value is 5.

guest_review_count.description: The guest review count of this product in expedia web site.

avg_nightly_price.description: Price per night for the hotel

total_price.description: Total price for the hotel stay

checkin_date.description: Check-in date for the hotel stay in format YYYY-MM-DD

checkout_date.description: Check-out date for the hotel stay in format YYYY-MM-DD

currency.description: Currency in which avg nightly price is specified

url.description: Link to the hotel on Expedia.\ \ Include this in the user response prompt whenever available. \

preview_photo.description: A link to the preview photo of the hotel. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

EXTRA_INFORMATION_TO_ASSISTANT.description: Specific instructions on how assistant is supposed to handle the data included in the API response

legs.description: The list of flight legs in the segment.

number_of_stops.description: Total number of stops in this segment

flight_duration.description: Total duration of the flight segment

price_per_ticket.description: Price per ticket for the selected Flight

currency.description: Currency in which ticket price is specified

departure_date.description: Date of departure of the flight in format 'YYY-MM-DD'

departure_time.description: Time of departure of the flight in format 'HH:mm aa'

arrival_time.description: Time of arrival of the flight in format 'HH:mm aa'

url.description: Link to book the flight on Expedia. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

preview_photo.description: A link to the preview photo of the flight. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

flight_number.description: Flight number corresponding to the airline.

EXTRA_INFORMATION_TO_ASSISTANT.description: Specific instructions on how assistant is supposed to handle the data included in the API response

price_per_ticket.description: Price per ticket for the activity

currency.description: Currency in which ticket price is specified

url.description: A link to the activity product on Expedia. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

preview_photo.description: A link to the preview photo of the activity. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

EXTRA_INFORMATION_TO_ASSISTANT.description: Specific instructions on how assistant is supposed to handle the data included in the API response

supplier_name.description: The supplier name of this car product.

pickup_address.description: The pickup address information of the location.

pickup_date.description: The date time that pickup the car.

dropoff_address.description: The dropoff address information of the location

dropoff_date.description: The date time that dropoff the car.

total_price.description: Total price for the car with currency

currency.description: Currency in which total price is specified

url.description: A link to the car product on Expedia. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

preview_photo.description: A link to the preview photo of the car. \ \  Include this in the user response prompt whenever available.\

info.title: KAYAK - Flights, Hotels, Cars
info.description: A plugin that allows users to search for the best deals on flights, hotels and cars

post.summary: Search flights on a flight route for certain dates

parameters.description: The format of the response.

parameters.description: The format of the response.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the response.

post.summary: Find places to go on a budget. This endpoint will return destinations that can be reached by plane within the given budget.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the response.

post.summary: This endpoint can be used when the flight route is known yet the travel dates are flexible. For example a user may say they want to travel for 2 weeks whenever air fares are the lowest. Another example is that a user specifies a travel month without exact dates.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the response.

origin.description: The origin from which the flight starts. Will be approximated if not specified.

destination.description: The destination to which the flight goes

departDate.description: Departure date of the flight at the origin

departHourRange.description: Range of hours in between which the outgoing flight should depart. Hours between 0 and 23, ranges such as [12,14]. Only needed when a specific flight departure time is requested.

returnDate.description: Return date of the flight. Only required for round trip flights

returnHourRange.description: Range of hours in between which the return flight should depart. Hours between 0 and 23, ranges such as [12,14]. Only needed when a specific return flight departure time is requested.

cabinClass.description: Flight cabin class. Defaults to Economy class if not specified.

numAdults.description: Number of adults that are flying

numChildren.description: Number of children that are flying

preferredCarriers.description: Optional list of airlines that are preferred.

excludeCarriers.description: Optional list of airlines that should be avoided.

destination.description: The city where you need a stay

hotelName.description: Name of the specific hotel for which the user wants to search. Optional only required when a specific hotel is requested.

landmark.description: Optional landmark to refine the location

neighborhood.description: Optional neighborhood to refine the location

address.description: Optional address to refine the location

numAdults.description: Number of adults that are staying.

numChildren.description: Number of children that are staying

minNumStars.description: Minimum number of stars the accommodation should have

specialRequest.description: Any question or preference related to the accommodation for which we have no explicit query parameters.

preferredAmenities.description:
Specify one or many amenities that the accommodation should offer: 
- spa: Spa
- pool: Pool
- pet_friendly: Pet-friendly
- beach_front: At the beach front
- fitness_center: Fitness center
- kitchen: Kitchen
- parking: Parking
- adult_only: Adult-only accommodation
- wifi: Wi-Fi
- ev_charger: Charger for electric vehicles
- facilities_disabled_guests: Facilities for guests with disabilities
- elevator: Elevator

preferredFreebies.description:
Specify one or many freebies that should be included in the room rate:
- free_cancellation: Rate includes free cancellation
- free_breakfast: Rate includes breakfast
- free_internet: Rate includes free Internet access
- all_inclusive: All-inclusive rate

preferredClassifications.description:
Specify one or many classifications that allow us to understand better what kind of experience the user is looking for:
- bed_and_breakfast: Bed and breakfast
- motel: Motel
- inn: Inn
- capsule_hotel: Capsule hotel
- apartment: Apartment
- villa: Villa
- ryokan: Ryokan
- hostel: Hostel
- cottage: Cottage
- holiday_home: Holiday home

preferredAmbiances.description:
Specify one or many ambiances that allow us to understand better what kind of experience the user is looking for:
- boutique: Boutique hotel
- budget: Hotels that are budget-friendly
- romantic: Hotels suited for romantic trips
- historic: Hotels with a historic character
- family_friendly: Family-friendly accommodations

origin.description: The location where you want to pick your rental car

destination.description: The location where you want to drop off your rental car. Will take the origin if no other location is given.

pickupDate.description: The date when you want to pick up your rental car

pickupHour.description: Rental car pick up hour in 24-hour format. Optional parameter that defaults to noon.

dropoffDate.description: The date when you want to drop off your rental car

dropoffHour.description: Rental car drop off hour in 24-hour format. Optional parameter that defaults to noon.

origin.description: The origin from which the flight starts. Will be approximated if not specified.

destinationHints.description: Optional list of cities that are requested to be included in the results, if prices are available.

departDate.description: Departure date of the flight at the origin

returnDate.description: Return date of the flight. Must be specified when a departure date is given.

budgetUsd.description: Expected cost of round trip flight ticket for one person

useExactDates.description: Set to true if travel on specific dates is requested. The default is flexible travel within a time period.

minDays.description: Minimum duration that the suggested trips should have. Expressed in the number of days

maxDays.description: Maximum duration that the suggested trips should have. Expressed in the number of days

origin.description: The origin from which the flight starts. Will be approximated if not specified.

destination.description: The destination to which the flight goes

departDate.description: Departure date of the flight at the origin

returnDate.description: Return date of the flight. Only required for round trip flights

nonStopOnly.description: Only show non-stop pricing if non-stop flights are available on the requested route

itineraryLegs.description: The individual flight legs of the multi city itinerary.

numAdults.description: Number of adults that are flying

numChildren.description: Number of children that are flying

preferredCarriers.description: Optional list of airlines that are preferred.

excludeCarriers.description: Optional list of airlines that should be avoided.

origin.description: The origin from which the flight goes

destination.description: The destination to which the flight goes

departDate.description: Departure date specific to this flight leg

cabinClass.description: Flight cabin class. Defaults to Economy class if not specified.
